title: OpenSea revamp: Can OS2 set the stage for a potential comeback?
body: The OpenSea journey has been rough and controversial. The startup, fostered by Y Combinator, quickly became a tech unicorn and an NFT sector monopolist. By 2025 the OpenSea timeline became a “rise and fall” story. On Feb. 13, the New York-based company announced the launch of a new version, OS2. The tweaks address some of the concerns while ignoring others. The NFT (non-fungible token) market is still alive, despite losing momentum. The long-term trend is far from being inspiring. Nevertheless, in 2024, the overall NFT trading volume reached $8.8 billion. The launch of OS2 is aimed at flipping the trend, which is hardly an easy task. You might also like: NFT sales suffer, Pudgy Penguins plunge: Here’s the latest OpenSea and the NFT market crisis Following the NFT market decline in 2022 media outlets started to question whether NFTs are dead . In recent years, the sector received a lot of negativity due to multiple scams (users lost tens of millions of dollars), security breaches, insider trading, and alleged hypocrisy of those who claim NFTs are about art and not just a money grab . NFTs have been criticized both by crypto bros and crypto skeptics. Some in the crypto community think NFTs did the crypto sector a disservice, distracting people from innovation while pushing hard-to-swallow narratives about selling JPEGs for millions of dollars and exposing newbies to risky investments. Many people who didn’t know much about crypto began to use the terms “crypto” and “NFTs” interchangeably, associating both with frauds, risks, gambling, etc. Nearly any accusation pointed at NFTs more or less applies to OpenSea as the dominating marketplace in the sector (boasting a 90% market share at its peak, dropping to 33% in 2025). According to the Verge article , a former company employee likened all the fraud, money grab, and craze that was going on across the platform in 2022 to a “blood orgy.” You might also like: OpenSea users targeted in phishing scam disguised as official NFT offers The crypto bear market worsened the company’s wealth as it stored funds in Ether ( ETH ). It saw a severe price decline in 2022. The rise of Blur and Magic Edan, the strong competitor platforms, contributed to the faster fall of OpenSea. The company was looking for new directions and ways to revitalize. At the very same time, it was continuing a series of unexpected layoffs. Additionally, the SEC unleashed a battle on NFTs and OpenSea was one of the targets. While the NFT market left the headlines and shrunk substantially, OpenSea has turned from a monopolist to a shaken survivor. The platform revamp was vital and, finally, we will witness a new version of OpenSea. What will change with the launch of OS2? The platform got a total update. The main direction is switching to a web3 realm. Now, it allows the trade of both fungible and non-fungible tokens. OS2 seamlessly works across various chains, eliminating the need to bridge or swap tokens. The long-anticipated launch of an OpenSea token ($SEA) is aimed at fostering long-term sustainability. OS2 open beta is now live: • A fully reimagined product built entirely from the ground up, for collectors and pros • NFTs 🤝 tokens, brought together in one place • Brand new, beautiful ways to explore — beyond just the floor • 14 chains (welcome @flow_blockchain , ApeChain… pic.twitter.com/fTJT5eKsm2 — OpenSea (@opensea) February 13, 2025 Announcements were met positively, with users and beta testers sharing their first impressions. Some say they lack the previous features like searching for sales by trait, but generally, the update was met with support. Critics blame security issues and plagiarism for ruining OpenSea’s user experience and the official announcement hardly touches on these issues. Moreover, OpenSea founder Devin Finzer rather emphasized a more anarchic approach on social media. “The NFT bull market changed us,” Finzer said. “We got too corporate, too web2, and let fear of risk outweigh building for users.” A lot is changing at @opensea : • We're rolling out OS2 — a brand new OpenSea built from the ground up. NFTs 🤝 tokens. • $SEA is coming from @openseafdn • We're changing policies that didn’t make sense for web3: re-enabling locked items and delisted collections, and removing… https://t.co/RMeu2TQFMC — dfinzer.eth | opensea (@dfinzer) February 13, 2025 Considering how bad OpenSea handled various security issues during its best days, the absence of the safety segment in the announcement is disappointing. It seems that the switch to web3 may be an attempt to outsource protection to end users themselves. Hopefully, updates on security will follow soon. Probably the decreased market share of OpenSea and the overall decline of the NFT craze may help the company facilitate a safer and healthier user experience. The crypto-friendly climate — with Paul Atkins nominated by President Donald Trump to serve as chair of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission — sets a nice background, too. It remains to be seen whether the OpenSea revamp has the potential to become a comeback story. Read more: Leaked OpenSea user emails now public, SlowMist warns of phishing risks

title: XRP Price To New All-Time High? Analyst Says $5.8 Is Possible Following ‘Golden Cross’
body: The XRP price action has been one of the brighter spots in the cryptocurrency space in 2025, weathering virtually every storm the market has faced. However, the altcoin could not avoid the market downturn triggered by the new trade tariffs imposed by United States President Donald Trump. The price of XRP dropped to around $2.1 due to the bearish sentiment that engulfed the entire crypto market. However, the XRP token seems to be back on the bullish track, jumping by more than 12% on Friday, February 14. Here’s How XRP Could Reach New ATH In a Friday post on the X platform, pseudonymous crypto analyst Dark Defender shared an updated analysis of the XRP price. The popular crypto trader highlighted the altcoin’s potential to a new all-time high around the $8 level over the next few weeks. Related Reading: XRP Spikes 5% After SEC’s ETF Acknowledgment Sends ‘Enormous Message’ The price of XRP rallied towards $2.8 after the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) acknowledged Grayscale’s XRP ETF application. According to Dark Defender, this positive price action has provided a springboard for the altcoin’s next move. However, the crypto pundit noted that the XRP price needs to clear some hurdles, specifically a major resistance zone around $2.9, to run up to the critical Fibonacci level of $5.85 and potentially 8.03 (an almost 200% rally from the current price). Interestingly, this projection is reinforced by changes in the daily Relative Strength Index (RSI) indicator. The RSI is a technical analysis indicator used to measure the balance between a token’s bullish and bearish momentum. According to Dark Defender’s post on X, the XRP RSI has recently formed a Golden Cross, a signal often associated with increased buying pressure. In the RSI — as with other indicators — a Golden Cross occurs when a short-term moving average crosses above a longer-term moving average. Typically, Golden Cross formations are associated with extended bullish periods, increasing the odds of XRP price maintaining its upward trend toward $5.85 and beyond. If this bullish scenario does not hold, the next support level to watch out for lies around $2.44. However, if the XRP price does not defend this demand zone in case of a pullback, investors could see the fall to the $2.3 mark. XRP Price At A Glance As of this writing, the price of XRP stands at around $2.7, reflecting an over 10% increase in the past 24 hours. According to data from CoinGecko, the third-largest crypto is up by nearly 14% in the past seven days. Related Reading: Ethereum Indicator Flashes Buy Signal On The Weekly Chart – Potential For A Rebound? Featured image from iStock, chart from TradingView

title: A Closer Look At the Best Long-Term Cryptos Commanding Stellar Community Involvement
body: The crypto market is fueled by pioneering ideas and community spirit, offering some of the most compelling investment prospects from the best long-term cryptos backed by dedicated and active communities. While giants like Bitcoin and Ethereum hold the mainstream spotlight, it’s often the lesser-known projects with robust community engagement that experience rapid growth. Among these best long-term cryptos, Web3Bay towers above the competition as the decentralized commerce juggernaut, having already amassed over $1 million in presale funds. Accompanied by four other cryptos with robust communities, they are all set to be the potential superstars of 2025. Web3Bay (3BAY): Fueling Decentralized Commerce Beyond just meme coins and speculative assets, Web3Bay addresses a significant real-world challenge—the shortcomings of traditional e-commerce platforms such as Amazon and eBay. These centralized behemoths impose hefty fees, limit sellers, and manipulate data, hindering small businesses and independent vendors. Web3Bay rectifies these issues by facilitating a direct buyer-to-seller marketplace without intermediaries. This shift leads to reduced fees, enhanced control, and a genuinely decentralized shopping experience via blockchain. Its community-led governance model ensures that it is the users, not big corporations, who dictate the platform’s future. This model has propelled Web3Bay’s presale success, quickly raising over $1 million. Investors are catching on that Web3Bay is more than a cryptocurrency; it’s a revolution poised to transform e-commerce indefinitely. Dogwifhat (WIF): The Pinnacle of Meme Coin Fervor Dogwifhat (WIF) has surged in the crypto scene, fueled by a fervent, highly engaged community. Its whimsical branding and robust social media activity have catapulted it into prominence, marking it as one of the best long-term cryptos for 2025. However, WIF’s growth is predominantly driven by community buzz rather than tangible applications, making it a volatile choice. While it might offer short-lived spikes, it doesn’t possess the enduring adoption potential that Web3Bay has. Ondo Finance (ONDO): Bridging DeFi with Institutional Investors Ondo Finance is carving a niche as a DeFi protocol linking institutional investors with blockchain financial solutions. With a growing community and an increasing total value locked, ONDO is drawing significant attention. Yet, while Ondo caters to institutional players, Web3Bay’s focus on everyday commerce renders it more accessible to the average user, thereby enhancing its potential for widespread growth. Kaspa (KAS): The Speediest Proof-of-Work Crypto? Kaspa (KAS) is gaining attention with its rapid proof-of-work consensus mechanism, offering quick and scalable blockchain transactions. Kaspa’s strong community backing supports its ascent, despite general market downturns. Still, the future of proof-of-work cryptos is under scrutiny as many move toward more sustainable models. While Kaspa’s innovations are notable, Web3Bay’s clear use case in e-commerce outlines a more definite path to broad adoption. Hedera (HBAR): The Preferred Enterprise Blockchain Hedera (HBAR) shines as a top enterprise blockchain solution known for its efficiency and low-cost transactions. Its governance model, supported by major firms, maintains a dedicated and engaged community. Nevertheless, while Hedera targets corporate adoption, Web3Bay aims to democratize blockchain for everyday consumers, potentially leading to higher transaction volumes and practical use cases. Web3Bay’s 100X Potential: The Best Long-Term Crypto Investment While Dogwifhat leverages meme magic, Ondo caters to institutions, Kaspa champions PoW efficiency, and Hedera serves enterprises, Web3Bay is poised to revolutionize a sector that touches billions daily—online shopping. Its versatile payment system, supporting both crypto and traditional transactions (including PayPal), enhances its accessibility, addressing a major barrier to Web3 adoption. Having already secured over $1 million in presale funds, Web3Bay’s trajectory demonstrates its community’s growing strength. Early backers see Web3Bay not merely as a speculative asset but as a practical blockchain application with lasting relevance. As the Web3Bay marketplace gains momentum, the demand for its 3BAY token is expected to soar, potentially leading to significant price increases. Unlike other low-cap cryptos dependent on hype, speculation, and corporate support, Web3Bay uniquely addresses a trillion-dollar challenge in e-commerce. Key Insights! As Dogwifhat capitalizes on meme culture, Ondo Finance expands its DeFi footprint, Kaspa pushes PoW capabilities, and Hedera fortifies its enterprise blockchain, the spectrum of committed communities supporting these best long-term cryptos is broad. However, the most potent community is the one forging real-world utility—and Web3Bay is proving that its decentralized commerce vision is more substantial than mere buzz. For those scouting the premier Web3 investment for 2025, Web3Bay undoubtedly leads the race as its presale concludes and demand escalates.
